meanings.definition: A person who hitches a ride.
meanings.sent1: The hitchers waited by the roadside for a kind driver to pick them up.
meanings.sent2: The group of hitchers thumbed a lift from passing cars on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The hitchers joked about starting a race to see who could get a ride first.
meanings.sent4: The hitchers were like magnets, attracting rides wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hitchers standing with their thumbs out became a familiar sight on the road.

meanings.sent1: Several hitchers gathered at the gas station, hoping for a ride together.
meanings.sent2: The hitchers waved happily as they climbed into the back of the truck.
meanings.sent3: The hitchers formed a line, each eager to catch a lift to the next town.
meanings.sent4: The hitchers, like a flock of birds, moved from one vehicle to another seeking a lift.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the hitchers walking along the road in a group was a common occurrence in that area.

meanings.sent1: The hitchers shared stories of their adventures on the road with fellow travelers.
meanings.sent2: Passing drivers often stopped to offer the hitchers a ride to their destination.
meanings.sent3: The hitchers carried signs with witty messages to attract drivers' attention.
meanings.sent4: The hitchers, like nomads of the modern age, roamed the highways in search of new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The community of hitchers formed a tight-knit group, supporting each other during their journeys.
